title: Adobe font
content:

comments.content:
I believe they use their own Minion and Myriad. (Tip: you'll get much faster response on the [Type Identification Board](http://web.archive.org/web/20080414165241/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/83.html?1063783156) here.)   
   
(Okay, not much faster. I forget that Typophile is two hours west of me. It was 11:30 here when I posted.)

_\> Tip: you'll get much faster response on the Type   
Identification Board here._      
   
Five minutes is pretty darn fast for an ID in my book,   
Mark! ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080414165241im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/lol.gif) Spot on ID BTW.

Hey, it was an easy one and I happened to be checking Typophile just when Mike posted his question.   
   
(Yves, I would participate more on the TIB--I'm sure I could hold my own there with rest of you--but I'd never get anything else done! ;-)
A lot of places are using Minion and Myriad now...even Apple seems to be using them now. Our local news paper, The Orlando Sentinel, uses Minion and Myriad as well.
